project_abstract.cdata: The Private Sector Development Project will foster the development of a competitive private sector by: a) assisting the Government in building on its investment liberalization by supporting its efforts to restructure, reform and commercialize its technical research and development establishment along competitive and demand driven principles; b) providing to a broad segment of the private sector the necessary financial and technial assistance to support the development of commercially bankable projects by improving their feasiblity and quality; c) supporting efforts by the export industry to improve their design and the promotion of their products; and d) assisting the Government in developing a program to upgrade the delivery of legal services to the commercial and manufacturing sectors. The project includes the following components: 1) technical assistance and training to the Secretariat of Ghana's Council for Scientific and Industrial Research and four institutes; 2) technology and enterprises development fund to assist on a pilot basis private small- and medium-size enterprises in increasing their efficiency to develop value-added products and provide reliable services, developing their technical and financial plans; 3) funding for market studies and surveys to determine market demand for a trade promotion facility; and 4) a feasibility and market study to determine the scope, financial viability, commercial demand and structure of an industrial design center.
